macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls Surge, Sparking Rate Hike Speculation
items.summary: The U.S. job market demonstrated strength with a significant increase in non-farm payrolls, leading to market speculation about potential Federal Reserve interest rate hikes. This contributed to mixed market sentiment with a slight risk-on shift.[1]

items.title: NASDAQ Composite Drops Over 1% to 23,255 on February 3
items.summary: The NASDAQ Composite Index closed at 23,255.190 on February 3, down from 23,592.110 on February 2, reflecting a decline of approximately 1.4% amid broader market fluctuations.[2]

items.title: Euro Strengthens to 1.0900 on Strong German Manufacturing Data
items.summary: EUR/USD rose to around 1.0900, bolstered by better-than-expected German manufacturing figures, while USD/JPY hit 145.50 due to rising U.S. Treasury yields.[1]

items.title: Bank of England Holds Rates Amid Inflation Concerns
items.summary: The Bank of England maintained interest rates, but signaled potential future hikes due to inflation pressures, contributing to GBP/USD volatility near 1.2500.[1]

items.title: Australian Dollar Resilient at 0.6500 on Trade Surplus
items.summary: AUD/USD held at 0.6500 supported by an AUD 8 billion trade surplus and stabilizing Chinese economy, while USD/CAD rose to 1.3700 amid oil price swings.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Reaches $2.62T with 0.88% Daily Gain
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization stands at $2.62 trillion, marking a 0.88% increase over the past 24 hours, as reported in Binance's latest market update.[1]

items.title: LBank Launches 15th BoostHub Campaign with 1 BTC Reward Pool
items.summary: LBank announced its 15th BoostHub initiative featuring Bitcoin, offering 1 BTC in rewards from February 4, 9:00 to February 11, 13:00 UTC, aimed at democratizing access to crypto opportunities for users worldwide.[2]

items.title: 2026 Stablecoin Predictions Highlight Market Bifurcation and Regulatory Shifts
items.summary: Stablecoins are evolving into core payment infrastructure with a split between regulated onshore versions for institutions and offshore liquidity options; DeFi lending is maturing toward structured credit markets while CBDCs lag in adoption.[3]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Robotics Forces Fundamental Rethink of AI Compute Infrastructure
items.summary: Robotics deployment is driving a shift in AI infrastructure toward hybrid edge-cloud systems for low-latency inference, multimodal data handling, and continuous learning from simulations and real-world feedback. Nebius' Head of Physical AI highlights the need for purpose-built platforms to scale robot fleets effectively.

items.title: Nine Bold AI Predictions for 2026 from AGI Pioneer
items.summary: Ben Goertzel, father of AGI, forecasts 2026 advancements including memory-equipped AI assistants, AI solving open math problems like Clay Millennium Prizes, surprising AI art, and a possible AGI breakthrough. He emphasizes alternative architectures beyond scaling LLMs.

items.title: Emotion AI Market Projected to Reach $15.57 Billion by 2030
items.summary: The emotion AI market is set to grow from $4.71 billion in 2025 to $5.99 billion in 2026 at a 27.2% CAGR, driven by customer analytics, biometric sensors, and applications in healthcare and security. Key trends include multimodal sensing and deep learning for facial and voice emotion recognition.

items.title: SAIR Launches AI for Science Kickoff 2026 Event
items.summary: SAIR begins public operations with AI for Science: Kickoff 2026, focusing on accelerating scientific discovery through artificial intelligence applications.

items.title: Ho Chi Minh Schools Report Success in Early AI Education Integration
items.summary: Schools in Ho Chi Minh City have effectively integrated AI into curricula, from basic lessons to advanced machine learning and research projects, boosting student competencies and competition wins. Teacher training supports personalized learning and AI thinking development.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Next 3D Mario Game Leaked Alongside General Nintendo Direct Rumor
items.summary: Rumors suggest a major 3D Mario title has leaked, potentially to be revealed in a General Nintendo Direct in the third week of February 2026. The leak comes from a source with a track record including the Donkey Kong Bananza leak, aligning with Nintendo's early 2026 plans.[1]

items.title: Tragic Incident: Three Sisters Jump from 9th Floor Over Online Gaming Dispute
items.summary: Three sisters aged 12, 14, and 16 jumped off the 9th floor of a building in Ghaziabad after their parents objected to their online gaming. The incident highlights concerns around gaming addiction.[8]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: KKR and Singtel Consortium Acquires STT GDC for $5.2 Billion
items.summary: A consortium led by KKR and Singtel has agreed to buy STT GDC, a major data center provider, in a $5.2 billion deal. This significant transaction highlights ongoing consolidation in the data center infrastructure sector.

items.title: Netflix Addresses Potential HBO Max Merger Concerns
items.summary: Netflix executives stated users can cancel if a potential merger with HBO Max raises prices, noting 80% of HBO Max subscribers already use Netflix. The discussions emphasize challenges in software integration for streaming platforms.

items.title: Global Tech Stock Selloff Hits Asian Markets and Indian IT Firms
items.summary: Tech weakness from U.S. markets rippled into Asia, with Hang Seng Tech dropping below key support levels and Indian IT firms facing heavy losses amid a broader rotation out of growth stocks. Software companies are under pressure from sector shifts.

items.title: AMD Shares Fall After Disappointing Outlook
items.summary: AMD extended losses following an outlook that failed to meet investor expectations, contributing to the chip sector's decline amid a tech stock rotation. The selloff reflects broader market skepticism on growth prospects.
